title: Past Perfect & Narrative Tenses
description: Master telling stories and reporting past events using narrative tenses.

rules.title: Past Perfect Structure
rules.explanation: Use the past perfect (had + past participle) to show that one action happened before another past action. It creates a 'past in the past.'

examples.sentence: By the time the police arrived, the thieves had escaped.
examples.translation: 경찰이 도착했을 때 도둑들은 이미 도망친 후였다.

examples.sentence: She realized she had left her keys at the office.
examples.translation: 그녀는 사무실에 열쇠를 두고 온 것을 깨달았다.

examples.sentence: They had never seen such a beautiful sunset before.
examples.translation: 그들은 그렇게 아름다운 일몰을 전에 본 적이 없었다.

rules.title: Past Perfect vs Past Simple
rules.explanation: Use past simple for the main events in chronological order. Use past perfect to show something happened earlier or to provide background information.

examples.sentence: When I arrived at the station, the train had already left.
examples.translation: 내가 역에 도착했을 때 기차는 이미 떠난 뒤였다.

examples.sentence: He told me that he had finished the report.
The movie had started before we got our seats.
examples.translation: 우리가 자리에 앉기 전에 영화가 시작했었다.

rules.title: Past Perfect Continuous
rules.explanation: Use past perfect continuous to emphasize the duration or ongoing nature of an action that happened before another past action.

examples.sentence: She had been waiting for two hours when he finally arrived.
examples.translation: 그가 마침내 도착했을 때 그녀는 두 시간 동안 기다리고 있었다.

examples.sentence: They were tired because they had been traveling all night.
examples.translation: 그들은 밤새 여행하고 있었기 때문에 피곤했다.

examples.sentence: It was obvious that the child had been crying.

rules.title: Narrative Tenses in News Reports
rules.explanation: News reports often combine different past tenses. Past simple reports main events, past continuous describes ongoing background actions, and past perfect shows earlier events.
rules.structure: Past Simple (events) + Past Continuous (background) + Past Perfect (earlier)

examples.sentence: The accident occurred while commuters were traveling to work. Police had received several warnings beforehand.
examples.translation: 통근자들이 출근하는 동안 사고가 발생했다. 경찰은 사전에 여러 경고를 받았었다.

examples.sentence: The fire started in the basement and spread quickly. Investigators later discovered that someone had left a candle burning.
examples.translation: 화재는 지하실에서 시작되어 빠르게 번졌다. 조사관들은 나중에 누군가가 촛불을 켜둔 채로 둔 것을 발견했다.

examples.sentence: Protesters were gathering outside the building when police arrived. They had been demonstrating peacefully since morning.
examples.translation: 경찰이 도착했을 때 시위자들이 건물 밖에 모이고 있었다. 그들은 아침부터 평화롭게 시위를 하고 있었다.

rules.title: Time Expressions with Past Perfect
rules.explanation: Certain time expressions are commonly used with the past perfect to clarify the sequence of events.
rules.structure: by the time, before, after, already, just, never... before, until

examples.sentence: By the time I finished work, the shops had closed.
examples.translation: 내가 일을 끝냈을 때 상점들은 문을 닫은 뒤였다.

examples.sentence: She had just left when you called.
examples.translation: 네가 전화했을 때 그녀는 막 떠난 참이었다.

examples.sentence: I didn't know he had already eaten until he told me.
examples.translation: 그가 말해주기 전까지 나는 그가 이미 먹었는지 몰랐다.

rules.title: Reported Speech with Past Perfect
rules.explanation: When reporting what someone said in the past, past simple often shifts to past perfect to maintain the sequence of events.

examples.sentence: He said he had seen the accident happen.
examples.translation: 그는 사고가 일어나는 것을 봤다고 말했다.

examples.sentence: The witness claimed she had been at home all evening.
examples.translation: 목격자는 저녁 내내 집에 있었다고 주장했다.

examples.sentence: Officials announced that they had reached an agreement.

exercises.question: By the time we _____ the news, everyone else _____ already _____.
The journalist discovered that the company _____ (hide) evidence for years.
She _____ for the interview all week when they suddenly canceled it.
By the time the ambulance arrived, the victim _____ (already / lose) consciousness.
The politician denied that he _____ any illegal payments.
They were exhausted because they _____ (travel) for over 24 hours.

exercises.instruction: Combine into one sentence using past perfect
exercises.original: The meeting ended. Then I arrived.
exercises.answer: By the time I arrived, the meeting had ended.

exercises.question: When the police searched the house, the suspects _____ all the evidence.
I _____ (never / hear) of that organization until I read the article.
The reporter explained that the accident _____ while workers _____ on the bridge.
